TopicTitle: 3D Map of all known earth satellites

Articles.Content:
Found this link cleaning out some of my old files, thought I would share it here.

 

http://richiecarmichael.github.io/sat/index.html

 

Australia gets first place in the "Not Junk/Junk" category at a ratio of 13/1.

China comes in last at 1/18!

That is so cool!

It was easy to see the two main bands of geosynch sats. I was expecting to see more obvious rings around LEO but I didn't.
Well according to the map each satellite is a kilometer or so in size.

Looks like a protoplanetary disk. A gaseous sphere of proto-star particles on LEO and a ring of planetesimales on a geostationary orbit. 100 years more - and the geostationary satellites will stick together and form a Death Star.
Or like a galaxy with a spherical bulge and scattered disk. 100 years more - and there be spiral arms.

Edited February 20, 2016 by kerbiloid
Some of the orbits are real strange, looks like they use an rotating earth reference frame as geo satellites are stationary.
To be pedantic, I couldn't find the moon anywhere. "3D map of almost all the known satellites". On a more serious note, cool find! I spent way too much time looking through it and not working

10 hours ago, magnemoe said:

Some of the orbits are real strange, looks like they use an rotating earth reference frame as geo satellites are stationary. 

Oh, were they actually moving? I thought it was just a static snapshot. Guess I didn't watch long enough.

22 hours ago, sevenperforce said:

That is so cool!

It was easy to see the two main bands of geosynch sats. I was expecting to see more obvious rings around LEO but I didn't.

That's because LEO uses a lot of inclinations, which are different for each satellite

3 hours ago, sevenperforce said:

Oh, were they actually moving? I thought it was just a static snapshot. Guess I didn't watch long enough.

You have to click the sats.
